Body:
I just started with Arduino/ESP32 IoT and look for a suitable platform (local and remote hosting). Blynk works fine, but is limited to cell phones. Thus I tried Thinger.io and ThingsBoard.io to send, store and visualize data from remote sensors on Arduino/ESP8266/ESP32 systems. Unfortunately, the MQTT protocol seems to be blocked by my network (I have no access to the router). Thus, I am looking for code examples using the HTTP protocol.

I tried the example documented at https://thingsboard.io/docs/samples/esp8266/temperature/ Temperature upload over MQTT using ESP8266 and DHT22 sensor

// WiFi and connection to Thingsboard Server	#define WIFI_AP "WLAN-XX"	#define WIFI_PASSWORD "78s1A"	#define TOKEN "eWdqwftFL"	char thingsboardServer[] = "http://192.168.11.103";	WiFiClient wifiClient;	PubSubClient client(wifiClient);	int status = WL_IDLE_STATUS;	unsigned long lastSend;		void setup() {	  Serial.begin(57600);	  // Wifi and Thingsboard	  InitWiFi();	  client.setServer( thingsboardServer

Body: Just a guess: I think you are using the wrong `clientId` (ESP8266 Device")..."
